page.title: 20Mrs Wellington-Recollections
page.content: Mrs. Wellington was 3 times mayor of Romsey in the 1950's.{Traffic}During her childhood there were only 4 cars in Romsey. Most people had to walk everywhere and as a result were fitter than they are today.{Industry}Most people worked in Strongs-a brewery. Other industries included a boatyard, and a jam factory.{Drains}Not many people had inside toilets so most had an outside privy. Twice a week a night cart came to clear away all the mess. In 1935 drains were built but they were installed incorrectly and this led to an epidemic of diptheria.{ {Oddments}Mrs. Wellington said that she was never fond of television, but she liked plays and ballet. She noted that when she was a child some dangerous illnesses were easier to catch, most noticeably diptheria, polio, measles and whooping cough.
